result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Dismissed on Motion of the State

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Question from the Jurors
UNSIGNED NOT GUILTY VERDICT FORMS on Count 1, 2, 3 & 4
GUILTY on Count 1, 2, 3 & 4

Jury Trial - Day Two 

Cases heard at this time are:  22CF466 & 22TR615
Defendant Melissa Marie Carter in Court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in Court for defendant, Melissa Marie Carter.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  Detective Connor Selvey appears in Court with ADA Cassidy.

8:28 a.m.  Court is in session.
Both parties agree that the jury instructions are acceptable.
8:30 a.m.  The jury is escorted in to the courtroom.  All 13 jurors appear.
Court gives closing instructions to the jurors. 
8:51 a.m.  Court re-reads the instruction for count 1.

CLOSING ARGUMENTS:
8:53 a.m.  ADA Cassidy makes closing arguments.
9:11 a.m.   Atty Bergner makes closing arguments. 
9:19 a.m.  ADA Cassidy makes rebuttal arguments. 

9:27 a.m.   Clerk randomly picks the alternate with the use of the tumbler. 
Juror #1852 is drawn. 
Court addresses the alternate juror and gives additional instructions to the jurors. 
Court continues with closing instructions to the jurors. 
Court reads the verdict forms. 
Verdict must be reached unanimously. 

9:31  a.m. Clerk administers the Oath of Officers to the Bailiffs. 
Court provides the jury instructions and verdict forms to the Bailiff to provide to the jury. 
9:31 a.m.  Jurors are escorted from the courtroom to begin their deliberations. 
Court addresses attorneys. 
Court informs the parties that on the jury instructions - pages 5 & 6 are in error.
Court will have these corrected and provide the jury instructions to the jurors.
Neither party has anything to put on the record. 
9:33 a.m.  Court is in recess. 
11:03 a.m.  Court is back in session.
Appearances remain as they were previous.
Jurors have a question - they are in agreement on one count but are at an impasse on the other 3 counts.
ADA Cassidy makes statements.
Atty Bergner asks for the jury instruction with regards to the court informing them to deliberate a while longer. 
Atty Bergner believes that is an appropriate instruction and the Court will give them jury instruction 520.
Court informs the parties as to what they should expect if the jurors have not reached a verdict by noon.
11:09 a.m.  Jurors are escorted into the courtroom.
Court reads their question back to them.
Court reads jury instruction 520 to the jurors.
11:10 a.m.  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom to continue their deliberations.
11:11 a.m.  Neither party has anything else to put on the record.
Court is in recess.

Random Listing Report for Voir Dire GF-141
Jury Selection & Peremptory Challenges GF-124 
Jury Trial Tracking Sheet
Juror Check in Sheet

11:55 AM Defendant Melissa Marie Carter in court.  Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner in court for Melissa Marie Carter.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Jurors are returned to the courtroom as the have a verdict
Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2 - Guilty
Count 3 - Guilty
Count 4 - Guilty

Court polls the jurors and they all raised their hands to confirm that the verdict was as stated on the record.
ADA Cassidy request Counts 2, 3, & 4 that the judgment of conviction be entered at this time and Count 1 be dismissed.
ADA Cassidy request bond be revoked.
BY THE COURT: Counts 2, 3, & 4 judgment of conviction is entered at this time and Count 1 is dismissed.
Atty Bergner states objections to bond being revoked.

BY THE COURT: Court will not revoke bond and orders the defendant to continue participating in the Pre-Trial Supervision Program and to make her required appointments.
Clerk has all exhibits accounted and in her possession.
Parties are to go to the Branch 1 Judicial Assistant and get a sentencing date.

12:04 PM Court in recess.

Exhibit #P1:  Flash Drive (not scanned)
Exhibit #P2:  Flash Drive (not scanned)
Exhibit #P3:  Photo of vehicle crashed in the ditch
Exhibit #P4:  Photo of front end of vehicle
Exhibit #P5:  Photo from front of vehicle
Exhibit #P6:  Photo from rear passenger side of vehicle
Exhibit #P7:  Photo of front seats of vehicle from driver side
Exhibit #P8:  Photo taken from driver side, driver seat, passenger seat, console
Exhibit #P9:  Photo taken from driver side, back seats
Exhibit #P10:  Informing the Accused
Exhibit #P11:  Driver Record Abstract
Exhibit #P12:  Photo of Defendant at jail
Exhibit #P13:  Photo of closer view of abrasions
Exhibit #D14:  Incident Report
Exhibit #P15:  Lab Report - results

CONTINUATION of Jury Trial - Day One 

State has no further witnesses.
State rests.

3:26 PM Court will take a short break, need to transition.

Atty Bergner takes a brief moment to talk to his client.
Defendant will not be testifying.
Atty Bergner has no other witnesses to call.

Court questions Defendant has to her right to testify and right to not testify.
Defendant understands.
Defendant's decision is to not testify.
Court questions Atty Bergner.

BY THE COURT: Court accepts Defendant's waiver to testify, knowingly and intelligently. 

Defense will be resting.
Parties are ready to have an instruction conference.
Parties have had time to look at the instructions.
Court gave a copy of the instructions to the parties.

Instructions are reviewed:
opening - no objection; 101 - remove; 103 - no objection; 115 - no objection; 2663 and 1765 are addressed; 235 - no other objection; 140 - no objection; 170 - no objection; 172 - discussions among parties - will include; 157 - no objection; 155 - no objection; 148 - no objection; 147 - will stay; 150 - remove; 190 - no objection; 195 - no objection; 300 - no objection, portion removed; 315 - requested; 200 - no objection; opinion of non expert witness - will stay; 327 - remove; 160; 465; verdict forms for 4 different counts; 515 - no objection. 

3:42 PM Court takes a break. 
All exhibits are accounted for.

3:53 PM Court is back on the record.
Appearances are the same as before.
Court checked with staff availability, will not conclude the hearing today, for reasons stated.

3:54 PM Jurors return to the courtroom.
Defense rests.
Evidentiary portion is concluded.
Court addresses timelines. 
Jurors will be released for the day, resume at 8:30 am, instructions, closing arguments and deliberate. 
Court reminds Jurors to not discuss matter with anyone or do any research.

3:57 PM Jurors are excused for tonight. Return at 8:30 am. 
Notebooks will be collected by the bailiffs, for the night.

Neither party has anything to put on the record at this time.
Court will provide final instructions to the parties as well as verdict forms.
Parties to meet at 8:15 am.

Jury Trial - Day One 

Cases heard at this time are 22CF-466 and 22TR-615.
Defendant Melissa Marie Carter in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Melissa Marie Carter.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. Detective Connor Selvey appears in Court with Atty Cassidy. 

PRE-TRIAL CONFERENCE/MOTIONS (PTC/MH/HE)
8:34 AM Court calls the case and welcomes the jurors. Court gives opening statements.

8:36 AM  Clerk administers Voir Dire Juror Oath. 

JURY SELECTION (JS)
8:37 AM  Clerk calls 23 jurors to be seated in the jury box. 
8:41 AM  Court reads alleged charges and introduces parties.
8:46 AM Court administers Voir Dire. 
8:50 AM Juror #1804 is excused for cause and replaced by Juror #1762.
8:52 AM Juror #1849 is excused for cause and replaced by Juror #1795.
8:56 AM Juror #1938 is excused for cause and replaced by Juror #1929.
9:06 AM Juror #1824 is excused for cause and replaced by Juror #1830.
9:17 AM Sidebar held.
9:18 AM Juror #1884 is excused for cause and replaced by Juror #1798.
9:18 AM Court takes a 5 minute comfort break. 
Bailiff verifies all jurors are present.
9:24 AM Court is back in session.
Court questions Juror #1798, to get caught up.
9:25 AM Atty Cassidy administers Voir Dire.
9:50 AM Atty Bergner administers Voir Dire.
10:04 AM  Parties exercise their peremptory strikes/challenges. While being conducted Court gives preliminary instructions to the Jurors.

10:13 AM The following jurors have been chosen: Juror #'s:1749, 1904, 1932,1837, 1852, 1791, 1810, 1786, 1856,1787, 1762, 1795 and 1929.
Parties state this is the Jury that has been selected.

10:16 AM  Court thanks the remaining jurors and excuses them at this time. 
10:18 AM Clerk administers Juror Oath.

10:19 AM Jurors are excused for short break, return at 10:45 AM.
10:20 AM Court will take a 15 minute break and return to discuss what was addressed in chambers.

10:36 AM Court is back in session, outside the presence of the jury.
Court recalls case.
Court states appearances.
Court addresses Atty Bergner if the stipulation was addressed with Defendant. 
Court administers a colloquey with Defendant.
Defendant will stipulate to several matters, which changes what evidence will hear.
Defendant stipulates that she has three prior convictions.
Defendant agrees that she has three prior convictions.
Court questions Atty Bergner as to the stipulation. 
Defendant stipulates that her license was revoked.
Court questions Atty Bergner as to the stipulation.
State does not object.
Defendant stipulates that she was subject to the .02 limit.
Court questions Atty Bergner as to the stipulation.
State has no questions.
BY THE COURT: Court will accept the three stipulations. Court removes these elements from the jury instructions.

The traffic citation can be resolved after this jury trial is concluded.
Court will allow the State to play the 911 call.
Court addresses legal issues before the next witness.

Clerk is Daniel.

JURY INSTRUCTIONS (JI)
10:48 AM Jury is escorted back into the courtroom.
Court informs the jurors of what they can expect from opening statements.
Court states that jurors are allowed to take notes.
Court informs jurors that the opening statements are not to be considered evidence, rather what the attorneys believe evidence will show.

JURY TRIAL (JT)

10:50 AM ADA Cassidy makes opening statements.
10:55 AM Atty Bergner makes opening statements.
10:58 AM ADA Cassidy calls Cody Smiley as witness.
Clerk swears in the witness.
11:00 AM Direct exam by Atty Cassidy.
ADA Cassidy requests to play a 911 call.
Court indicates the flash drive should be marked as an exhibit.
11:04 AM Exhibit P1 is marked as exhibt for ADA Cassidy.
ADA Cassidy questions the witness regarding the recording.
11:07 AM ADA Cassidy plays the 911 call from the flash drive marked as exhibit 1.
11:12 AM Recording concludes.
ADA Cassidy moves exhibit 1 into evidence.
No objection by Atty Bergner.

BY THE COURT:
Exhibit 1 is received as evidence on motion of ADA Cassidy.

11:13 AM Direct exam continues.
11:14 AM Cross exam by Atty Bergner.

11:15 AM Court informs the jury that a legal issue needs to be addressed.
Jury to take a 15 minutes break and return to the jury room by 11:30 AM.
11:16 AM Jury is escorted out of the courtroom.

11:16 AM Court indicates there are issues regarding statements after the defendant was detained pertaining to Miranda rights.
ADA Cassidy requests clarification regarding what the issues are.
Court responds and notes that some statements made by the defendant may need to be supressed, depending on when they were made.
ADA Cassidy states that the defendant should not be considered to have been in custody at the time the statements in question were made.
ADA Cassidy states that the statements should not be suppressed.
11:21 AM Atty Bergner notes that, in the police video, it isn't possible to tell when the defendant is in custody and provides further statements.
Court states that this issue should have been handled long ago and notes that Deputy Selvey should provide testimony.
Attys agree.
Court states that the jury will be informed they should return at 1:00 pm, after lunch.

Jury is not present at this time.
Exhibit P2, a flash drive containing police audio from the incident, is marked for ADA Cassidy.
11:26 AM Deputy Connor Selvey is sworn in.
Court questions the witness.
11:27 AM Direct exam by ADA Cassidy.
11:36 AM ADA Cassidy asks that Exhibit P2 be admitted and played.
No objection by Atty Bergner.

BY THE COURT:
Exhibit P2 is admitted.

11:36 AM ADA Cassidy plays the recording.
11:39 AM ADA Cassidy stops the recording at 2:35.
Direct exam continues.
ADA Cassidy resumes playing the recording.
11:40 AM ADA Cassidy stops the recording at 2:52.
ADA Cassidy resumes playing the recording.
11:41 AM ADA Cassidy stops the recording at 3:58.
Direct exam continues.
Court indicates there is not much time left.
ADA Cassidy indicates she will play the rest of the recording.
ADA Cassidy resumes the recording.
11:49 AM Court asks ADA Cassidy to pause the video and asks questions regarding the audio.
11:50 AM ADA Cassidy resumes the recording.
Clerk is April.
11:56 AM Atty Cassidy stops the recording at 16.53.
11:57 AM Cross examination by Atty Bergner. 
11:58 AM There is enough evidence to break.
Court will take a break at this time, return at 12:45 PM.
Court gives copy of the jury instructions to the parties. 

12:47 PM Court is back on the record, outside the presence of the Jury.
Appearances are the same as they were before.
Atty Cassidy addresses the Court, makes a few points as to previous discussions.
Atty Bergner addresses the Court, custody question/interrogation question are addressed.
Court addresses parties, cites case.
BY THE COURT: Court limits the play of video just before Deputy Selvey asks where Defendant is coming from.

Atty Cassidy raises one last argument with the order, cites case.  
Court replies, does believes that it qualifies for interrogation.

1:01 PM Jurors return to the courtroom.
Court thanks Jurors for returning.

1:02 PM C.S. is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Cassidy.
Exhibits #3-#6 are marked on behalf of Plaintiff,
BY THE COURT: Exhibits #3-#6 are offered and received and published to the Jury.
Witness identifies Defendant.
1:42 PM Exhibit #2 is played.  Start at 30 second mark.
Parties stipulate that recording may be played at this time. 
Recording starts at 30 seconds - recording ends at 16 minutes and 30 seconds. 
BY THE COURT: Exhibit #2 is offered and received. 
Exhibits #7-#9 are marked on behalf of Plaintiff.
BY THE COURT: Exhibits #7-#9 are offered and received and published to the Jury.
2:13 PM Sidebar taken.
2:14 PM Sidebar concluded.
Direct examination continues.
Exhibit #10 is marked on behalf of Plaintiff, is referred to.
BY THE COURT: Exhibit #10 is admitted.
2:22 PM Court will take a 15 minute break and then to conclude exam and for Atty Bergner to cross exam. Court will resume at 2:40 PM.
Briefly there was a sidebar regarding keys.  Court explains for the record, the discussion. Atty Bergner made an objection to Exhibit 10 regarding consent, is noted for the record.
2:25 PM Court breaks.
Exhibit #11 is marked on behalf of Plaintiff prior to the start of Court.
2:40 PM Court is back on the record.
Court questions Atty Cassidy regarding the status of witnesses to be called. Atty Cassidy replies.
2:41 PM Jurors return the courtroom.
2:42 PM C.S. retakes the stand, understands he is still under oath.
Direct examination by Atty Cassidy continues.
Exhibit #11 is referred to.
BY THE COURT: Exhibit #11 will be admitted.
Exhibits #12-#13 are marked on behalf of Plaintiff, are referred to.
BY THE COURT: Exhibits #12-#13 are admitted and may be published.
2:50 PM Cross examination by Atty Bergner.
Exhibit #8 is referred to. 
Exhibit #14 is marked on behalf of Defendant, is referred to. 
Exhibit #13 is referred to.
Exhibit #7 and #9 are referred to.
3:09 Testimony is concluded.

3:11 PM J.D. is called and sworn in.
Exhibit #15 is marked on behalf of Plaintiff.
Direct examination by Atty Cassidy.
BY THE COURT: Exhibit #15 is admitted and published.
3:21 PM Cross examination by Atty Bergner. 
3:23 PM Re-direct by Atty Cassidy.

3:24 PM C.S. is recalled.
Direct examination by Atty Cassidy.
3:26 PM Testimony is concluded.

Exhibit #P1 Flash Drive Containing 911 Recording (not scanned)
Exhibit #P2 Copy of Portage County Sheriff's Office - Law Supplement Narrative with Receipt of Returned Property

3:03 PM 
Defendant Melissa Marie Carter does not appear and is excused.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Melissa Marie Carter.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls the case and states appearances.
Court reviews the matters to be addressed at this time.
Court asks ADA Cassidy to play the 911 call that was mentioned at the hearing earlier today.
ADA Cassidy plays the recording as requested.
Court indicates that the recording should be placed on the record as an exhibit.
ADA Cassidy states that a jump drive can be provided to the clerk's office.
Atty Bergner provides a report outlining the property on the defendant's person at the time of the incident, for the court's review.
Court reviews the document and provides it back to Atty Bergner.
Court advises that the recording and the report should be provided to the clerk's office to be marked as exhibits.
Court asks that the 911 recording is to be marked as exhibit 1.
Court also asks that the deputy's report be marked as exhibit 2.
ADA Cassidy notes she understands.

Atty Bergner makes statements regarding confrontation clause.
ADA Cassidy makes statements.
Court notes that it will look into the issue further before tomorrow.
Court inquires as to a key that was part of the defendant's belongings.
Atty Bergner asks that it be excluded from being mentioned.
ADA Cassidy states that it should be admissible. 

BY THE COURT:
The report regarding the key is to be excluded, with conditions as stated.
Depending on what the defense presents, the report could be used as rebuttal evidence.

Court inquires as to what attys indicate as the number of convictions of the defendant.
Court indicates that the matter of convictions can be discussed tomorrow morning.

Parties to meet at 8 AM 10-20-2022.
Court provides a copy of Voir Dire to attys.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  
Bond continued.

10:06 AM 
Defendant Melissa Marie Carter in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Melissa Marie Carter.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Cassidy calls case and states appearances.
Court references a traffic citation in 22TR615.
Court notes that an amended criminal complaint was filed in 22CF466.
Atty Bergner waives a reading of the complaint.

ADA Cassidy state that an information was recently filed.
Atty Bergner wishes to move to arraignment.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court makes statements regarding the defendant's previous offenses.
Atty Bergner notes stipulations that will be agreed upon.
Court notes those will be discussed tomorrow.
Court inquires as to how ADA Cassidy would like to handle the traffic case.
Court notes that parties will receive copies of the proposed jury instructions and that they should provide input on those tomorrow morning.

Court moves on to motions in limine.

State's Motions in Limine:
1 - Granted, with the exception of the deputy stated.
2 - Granted.
3 - Granted.
4 - Granted.
5 - Granted.
6 - Granted.
7 - Granted.
8 - Granted.
9 - Granted.
10 - Granted.
11 - Granted.
12 - Granted .
13 - Does not apply.
14 - Granted.
15 - Taken under advisement.
16 - Taken under advisement.
Court questions Atty Bergner and the defendant regarding the latest offer from the state.
Defendant notes that she is not accepting the offer.
17 - Granted.
18 - Taken under advisement.
19 - Granted.

Defense's Motion in Limine:
1 - ADA Cassidy notes a piece of evidence to be admitted. Atty Bergner states that the evidence in question should not be admissible. Court questions ADA Cassidy further regarding the evidence.
ADA Cassidy notes she may need time to review the evidence. Court asks the parties to work this out. Motion to be addressed at a later time.
2 - Not Granted.
3 - Granted.
4 - Granted.
5 - Granted.

ADA Cassidy clarifies the conditions of the 5th motion in limine.
Court provides clarification.

Attys do not object to note taking by the jurors.
Attys agree with the court in regards to questions being asked by jurors.
Court inquires as to whether any police squad camera footage will be played.
ADA Cassidy notes that there will be footage played, as well as a 911 recording.
ADA Cassidy believes this trial will be done within 1 day.
Court requests that Attys keep Voir Dire fairly short - roughly 20 minutes.
Court request that Attys keep opening statements short - roughly 15 minutes.
Atty Bergner makes statements regarding the 911 recording to be played by the state.
ADA Cassidy responds and provides caselaw regarding the confrontation clause.
Court notes that it will need to take a careful look at this issue.

Parties to reconvene this afternoon at 3 pm.
Court requests that the defendant be present, but if there is an issue, they may be excused.
Court inquires as to having an alternate.
ADA Cassidy states there should be an alternate, in case the trial takes more than 1 day.

BY THE COURT:
Matter adjourned to 3pm 10-19-2022.
